text: Taiwan plane back home after China hijacking. TAIPEI 1997-03-10 A Taiwan airliner hijacked to China on Monday touched down safely in Taipei after an unprecedented direct crossing of the Taiwan strait from the rival communist Chinese mainland. The Far East Air Transport Boeing 757 landed at Taipei's domestic Sungshan Airport shortly after 8.00 p.m. (1200 GMT) and quickly was surrounded by police and rescue vehicles. The alleged hijacker, identified by Taiwan authorities as unemployed newsman Liu Shan-chung, was not aboard, having been detained in China's southeastern port of Xiamen. The plane and its nearly 160 passengers and crew made the flight from Xiamen in what appeared to be record time, having crossed the Taiwan strait directly rather_than making a detour through Hong Kong or Macau air space. In the 12 previous instances of mainland aircraft being hijacked to Taiwan, those planes were obliged by Taipei to return to China by way of such a "_ third place _". The indirect routings aimed to preserve Taiwan's decades-old ban on direct flights across the Taiwan strait and avoid giving official recognition to the communist Beijing government.
title: TAIWAN : Taiwan plane back home after China hijacking.
